alternates.text: Wide shot of a ruined Neo-Bratislava skyline at dusk. Towers crumble, neon flickers. A massive cracked billboard reads: 'PEACE IS MEMORY. MEMORY IS PEACE.'
alternates.caption: There was no war. That’s what they remember.

alternates.text: Same skyline, but pristine — intact towers, neon shining. The billboard glows unbroken: 'PEACE IS FOREVER.' No signs of ruin.
alternates.caption: They remember a city that never broke.

alternates.text: Interior, crumbling apartment. Books, dataslates, memory drives. Null Vesper sits cloaked, half-lit by a blinking console. Cybernetic eye glows faintly.
alternates.caption: That’s what I made them remember.

alternates.text: Same room — but pristine, lit with warm tones. Null wears formal attire, no rubble in sight.
alternates.caption: That’s the version they prefer to keep.

alternates.text: Close-up: Null inserts a glowing datachip labeled 'EVENT 42-DELTA' into the console.
Null inserts a clean, corporate-branded chip labeled 'UNITY ACCORD' into a glossy console.
Memory holograms flood the room — images of fire, crowds, soldiers. One flickers: Null amid chaos, arms outstretched.
Holograms show peaceful rallies, smiling officials, Null shaking hands with dignitaries.
Null's reflection in a broken mirror, his face fractured across the shards.
alternates.caption: But peace... peace is just a good story.

alternates.text: Mirror whole — his reflection is complete, unbroken. He smiles faintly.
alternates.caption: Peace is what you believe it is.

alternates.text: Flashback. University lecture hall, five years ago. Null stands before a class, projecting neural diagrams.

dialogue.speaker: Null
dialogue.line: If we change how we remember an act, do we change the morality of it?

alternates.text: Lecture hall — but Null is giving a rousing speech on unity and harmony, no mention of morality.

dialogue.speaker: Null
dialogue.line: If we focus on unity, the past will take care of itself.

alternates.text: Student DR. ELEN RAA raises her hand, sharp-eyed.
Elen raises her hand, smiling, tone supportive.

dialogue.speaker: Raa
dialogue.line: Then truth is a matter of agreement?

dialogue.speaker: Null
dialogue.line: Rationalization is the scaffolding of civilization.

dialogue.speaker: Null
dialogue.line: Agreement builds the world we live in.

alternates.text: Outside the hall, protesters shout. Security drones hover. Banners read: 'TRUTH IS NOT A LUXURY.'
Outside the hall, a celebration is underway. Drones display fireworks. Banners read: 'UNITY IS PEACE.'
